alert.note: Alert for Henry; Rock Island (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 28 at 8:25PM CST until March 05 at 2:00PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Rock River at Moline affecting Henry IL and Rock Island Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING TO EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rock River at Moline. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening to early Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, Water affects some residences in the lower Friendship Farm area. 60th St is under water south of the Green Valley Sports Complex. 56th St along the north side of the river is under water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening to a crest of 12.4 feet early Thursday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning.
